info.title: Google Analytics API
info.description: View and manage your Google Analytics data

get.description: Returns Analytics report data for a view (profile).

parameters.name: dimensions
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of Analytics dimensions. E.g., 'ga:browser,ga:city'.

parameters.name: end-date
parameters.description: End date for fetching report data. All requests should specify an end date formatted as YYYY-MM-DD.

parameters.name: filters
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of dimension or metric filters to be applied to the report data.

parameters.name: ids
parameters.description: Unique table ID for retrieving report data. Table ID is of the form ga:XXXX, where XXXX is the Analytics view (profile) ID.

parameters.name: max-results
parameters.description: The maximum number of entries to include in this feed.

parameters.name: metrics
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of Analytics metrics. E.g., 'ga:sessions,ga:pageviews'. At least one metric must be specified to retrieve a valid Analytics report.

parameters.name: segment
parameters.description: An Analytics advanced segment to be applied to the report data.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of dimensions or metrics that determine the sort order for the report data.

parameters.name: start-date
parameters.description: Start date for fetching report data. All requests should specify a start date formatted as YYYY-MM-DD.

parameters.name: start-index
parameters.description: An index of the first entity to retrieve. Use this parameter as a pagination mechanism along with the max-results parameter.

get.description: Lists all accounts to which the user has access.

parameters.name: max-results
parameters.description: The maximum number of accounts to include in this response.

parameters.name: start-index
parameters.description: An index of the first account to retrieve. Use this parameter as a pagination mechanism along with the max-results parameter.

get.description: Lists goals to which the user has access.

parameters.name: accountId
parameters.description: Account ID to retrieve goals for. Can either be a specific account ID or '~all', which refers to all the accounts that user has access to.

parameters.name: max-results
parameters.description: The maximum number of goals to include in this response.

parameters.name: profileId
parameters.description: View (Profile) ID to retrieve goals for. Can either be a specific view (profile) ID or '~all', which refers to all the views (profiles) that user has access to.

parameters.name: start-index
parameters.description: An index of the first goal to retrieve. Use this parameter as a pagination mechanism along with the max-results parameter.

parameters.name: webPropertyId
parameters.description: Web property ID to retrieve goals for. Can either be a specific web property ID or '~all', which refers to all the web properties that user has access to.

get.description: Lists views (profiles) to which the user has access.

parameters.name: accountId
parameters.description: Account ID for the views (profiles) to retrieve. Can either be a specific account ID or '~all', which refers to all the accounts to which the user has access.

parameters.name: max-results
parameters.description: The maximum number of views (profiles) to include in this response.

parameters.name: start-index
parameters.description: An index of the first entity to retrieve. Use this parameter as a pagination mechanism along with the max-results parameter.

parameters.name: webPropertyId
parameters.description: Web property ID for the views (profiles) to retrieve. Can either be a specific web property ID or '~all', which refers to all the web properties to which the user has access.

get.description: Lists advanced segments to which the user has access.

parameters.name: max-results
parameters.description: The maximum number of advanced segments to include in this response.

parameters.name: start-index
parameters.description: An index of the first advanced segment to retrieve. Use this parameter as a pagination mechanism along with the max-results parameter.

get.description: Lists web properties to which the user has access.

parameters.name: accountId
parameters.description: Account ID to retrieve web properties for. Can either be a specific account ID or '~all', which refers to all the accounts that user has access to.

parameters.name: max-results
parameters.description: The maximum number of web properties to include in this response.

parameters.name: start-index
parameters.description: An index of the first entity to retrieve. Use this parameter as a pagination mechanism along with the max-results parameter.

fields.name: fields
fields.description: Selector specifying which fields to include in a partial response.

key.name: key
key.description: API key. Your API key identifies your project and provides you with API access, quota, and reports. Required unless you provide an OAuth 2.0 token.

oauth_token.name: oauth_token
oauth_token.description: OAuth 2.0 token for the current user.

prettyPrint.name: prettyPrint
prettyPrint.description: Returns response with indentations and line breaks.

quotaUser.name: quotaUser
quotaUser.description: Available to use for quota purposes for server-side applications. Can be any arbitrary string assigned to a user, but should not exceed 40 characters. Overrides userIp if both are provided.

userIp.name: userIp
userIp.description: IP address of the site where the request originates. Use this if you want to enforce per-user limits.

scopes.https://www.googleapis.com/auth/analytic: View and manage your Google Analytics data
